tit.j: 公武法制応勅十八箇条
tit.e: Kobu-ochoku juhacca-jo (Imperial court and shogunate eighteen-article legislation)
Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo (Eighteen articles of Imperial court and shogunate legislation made by an Imperial order)
tit.cmt: 意味の併記部分でしたので訳漏れとは思いませんが、「応勅」について、補いました。また、ローマ字表記はヘボン式という指示に従い、juhakkaに修正致しました。
tit.e: Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo (Eighteen articles of Imperial court and shogunate legislation made by an Imperial order)

sen.j: 公武法制応勅十八箇条（こうぶおうちょくじゅうはっかじょう）とは、元和 (日本)元年（1615年）8月に徳川家康が、後水尾天皇の勅命を受けて御所の紫宸殿に掲げるために定めたとされている18ヶ条。
sen.e: Kobu-ochoku juhacca-jo is an eighteen-article legislation, which is said to be issued in 1625 by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who received an imperial order from Emperor Gomizunoo to display in gosho (Imperial Palace).

Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo was the name for eighteen articles which were said to be issued in August (old lunar calendar) 1615 by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who received an imperial order from Emperor Gomizunoo to display in Shishin den inside the Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記はヘボン式という指示に従い、juhakkaに修正致しました。「紫宸殿」と「8月」が訳漏れです。「8月」については、日付によって新暦変換時2つの月にまたがるため（9月または10月）、旧暦のままと致しました。
sen.e: Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo was the name for eighteen articles which were said to be issued in September 1615 by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who received an imperial order from Emperor Gomizunoo to display in Shishin den inside the Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換

sen.j: ただし、今日の法制史においては「偽法令」であるとされている。
sen.e: However, it is said to be a 'forged legislation' from the viewpoint of the present legal history.
In the present legal history however, it is considered as a 'forged legislation.'
sen.cmt: 語順を変え、平易に致しました。
sen.e: In the present legal history however, it is considered as a 'forged legislation.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『徳川禁令考』前集一に諏訪氏所蔵として引用されており、武家政道と天下太平について定めたものとされる。
sen.e: The legislation was quoted in the first edition of zenshyu owned by Suwa clan, in which samurai government and universal peace had been stipulated.
sen.cmt: 「徳川禁令考」を意訳併記しました。「前集」を意訳併記しました。
sen.e: It was quoted in part one of the first volume of "Tokugawa kinrei ko" (Tokugawa Interdictory) that it was in the possession of the Suwa clan, and the articles were considered to have specified a samurai government and peace for the whole nation.
sen.cmt: 「徳川禁令考」が訳漏れです。また、意訳も不明確でしたので可能な限り書き直しを致しました。
sen.e: It was quoted in part one of the first volume of "Tokugawa kinrei ko" (Tokugawa Interdictory) that it was in the possession of the Suwa clan, and the articles were considered to have specified a samurai government and peace for the whole nation.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: ところが、その内容は当時の幕府の法令に形式に則しておらず、特に第18条に至っては当時存在する筈の無い「東叡山」（寛永寺の山号）が含まれている。
sen.e: However, the contents are not accordance with the legislation of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in those days, and especially in the eighteenth article, description of 'Toei-zan' (Mt.Toei-zan) (sango [literally, "mountain name", which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple] of Knei-ji Temple) is contained.
sen.cmt: 文の最後に、『）が含まれている』を付けました。
sen.e: However, its contents were not in accordance with the legislation and ways of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at the time, and especially in article 18, 'Toei-zan' (Mt. Toei-zan) (sango [literally, "mountain name," which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple] of Kanei-ji Temple) which could not have existed, was contained.
sen.cmt: 文法、表記、スペルミスについて修正致しました。「法令に形式に」という原文の意味が不鮮明ですが、「法令と形式に」と推測で訳しました。
sen.e: However, its contents were not in accordance with the legislation and ways of the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) at the time, and especially in article 18, 'Toei-zan' (Mt. Toei-zan) (sango [literally, "mountain name," which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple] of Kanei-ji Temple) which could not have existed, was contained.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同寺の創建は元和元年から10年後の寛永2年（1625年）で、山号もこの時に天海が命名した）という言葉が登場するなど矛盾が多い。
sen.e: There are many contradictions in the contents, for example, Kanei-ji Temple was actually established in 1625, not in 1615 ten years later, and description that its sango was named by Tenkai is contained.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳例外対処
sen.e: There were many inconsistencies, such as the description on the Kanei-ji Temple that it was established in 1625 which was ten years after 1615, and that the temple was also named at this time by Tenkai.
sen.cmt: 語順などを変え、文が平易になるように致しました。
sen.e: There were many inconsistencies, such as the description on the Kanei-ji Temple that it was established in 1625 which was ten years after 1615, and that the temple was also named at this time by Tenkai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 今日の法制史の研究者の間ではその存在を否定されており、公家政権（朝廷）に対する江戸幕府の優越的地位を示すために創作された偽書であると考えられている。
sen.e: According to today's researchers of legal history, the existence of the temple is denied, and it is assumed that the document is a gisho (apocryphal book) which was created by the Edo bakufu in order to display its superiority in social position to the Kuge (court nobles) Government (Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳例外対処
sen.e: The existence of Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo is being denied by the researchers of legal history of the present day, and it is assumed that the document was a apocryphal book which was created by the Edo bakufu to display its superiority in social position over the Kuge (court nobles) Government (Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: 原文の「その」というのは、前文の寺ではなく、公武法制応勅十八箇条だと考えます。
sen.e: The existence of Kobu-ochoku juhakka-jo is being denied by the researchers of legal history of the present day, and it is assumed that the document was a apocryphal book which was created by the Edo bakufu to display its superiority in social position over the Kuge (court nobles) Government (Imperial Court).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、岡野友彦は源氏長者の地位を本来持っていた公家の役職としての奨学院淳和院両院別当としての意味から武家の棟梁としての意味に換骨奪胎していることに注目した。
sen.e: Furthermore, Tomohiko OKANO, a researcher, paid attention to the replacement of meaning of the post of Shogakuin Junnain ryo-in betto (Shogakuin: private school of Ariwara family; Junnain: a family school named after the Summer Place of Emperor Junnna; betto: school chancellor) where the meaning changed from kuge who originally had the social standing of Genji no chojya (chief of the Minamoto clan) to toryo (a leader of samurai family).
sen.cmt: 岡野友彦に、a researcherと併記一原文一訳例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, Tomohiko OKANO, a researcher, paid attention to the replacement of the meaning of Shogakuin Junnain ryo-in betto (Shogakuin: private school of Ariwara family; Junnain: a family school named after the Summer Place of Emperor Junnna; betto: school chancellor) as a post of Kuge that originally had the social standing of Genji no chojya (chief of the Minamoto clan) to toryo (a leader of samurai family) in the samurai class.
sen.cmt: 文法面を修正致しましたが訳については不安が残ります。
sen.e: Furthermore, Tomohiko OKANO, a researcher, paid attention to the replacement of the meaning of Shogakuin Junnain ryo-in betto (Shogakuin: private school of Ariwara family; Junnain: a family school named after the Summer Place of Emperor Junnna; betto: school chancellor) as a post of Kuge that originally had the social standing of Genji no chojya (chief of the Minamoto clan) to toryo (a leader of samurai family) in the samurai class.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この文書を偽造した人物が徳川将軍家が源氏長者の地位を根拠として公家政権（朝廷）の支配を行おうとした方針を文書に反映させているとしている。
sen.e: He assumes that a forger reflected on this monjo (written material) a policy of the Tokugawa Shogunate family to control the Kuge Government (Imperial Court) on the ground of their social standing as Genjino Choja (chief of the Minamonto Clan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳例外対処
sen.e: He assumes that a person who made the forgery reflected plans of the Tokugawa Shogunate family to control the Kuge Government (Imperial Court) based on their social standing as Genjino Choja (chief of the Minamonto Clan) on this monjo (written material).
sen.cmt: 語順などを変え、分かり易くなるように致しました。
sen.e: He assumes that a person who made the forgery reflected plans of the Tokugawa Shogunate family to control the Kuge Government (Imperial Court) based on their social standing as Genjino Choja (chief of the Minamonto Clan) on this monjo (written material).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
